SENT.plain: Angelman's syndrome, a genetic disorder involving a defect in the DNA coding for subunits of the gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) type A receptor, often is associated with intractable epilepsy
Topiramate is a novel anticonvulsant that enhances GABAergic neurotransmission
Five children with Angelman's syndrome and epilepsy were treated with topiramate for clinical indications
The drug was effective and well tolerated, possibly because of its GABAergic properties
Further studies are necessary to confirm and elucidate this observation
